faq.question: Why does my faja burn my skin?
faq.answer: Friction burns occur when fabric moves against skin or lacks breathability. Look for fajas lined with Viveltex (Vitamin E & Algae) to soothe skin and reduce friction. Cheap materials trap heat; our Cool-Touch nylon prevents this.

faq.question: How do I stop my faja from rolling down?
faq.answer: Rolling happens when the garment structure is too weak for your movement. You need 'Spiral Steel Bones'—flexible supports that keep the faja upright. Also, ensure you have a silicone lace edge that grips the skin.

faq.question: Will a high compression faja flatten my BBL?
faq.answer: Yes, if it's the wrong kind. Standard fajas compress everywhere. BBL-safe fajas must have a 'Zero Compression' zone made of thin mesh over the buttock area to protect the fat graft.

faq.question: How do I hide my FUPA?
faq.answer: You need localized lower-abdominal compression. Our Tri-Layer Panel targets the lower belly specifically without compressing the hips, flattening the 'pooch' while lifting the rest.
